purpose.summary: This DBD source defines the IMS database DBPAUTX0 as an index database using VSAM access with dataset DDPAUTX0. It specifies a single root segment PAUTINDX (6 bytes) with a unique packed decimal sequence field INDXSEQ at positions 1-6 for key-based access. The database provides logical child access to PAUTSUM0 segments in the physical database DBPAUTP0 via the ACCNTID total segment index.
purpose.business_context: Supports efficient index-based retrieval of account summary segments (PAUTSUM0) by account ID or sequence key in an IMS hierarchical database environment.

inputs.name: DDPAUTX0
inputs.description: VSAM dataset containing the index database physical storage.

inputs.name: PAUTINDX.INDXSEQ
inputs.description: Unique packed decimal sequence key field (positions 1-6, TYPE=P) in root segment PAUTINDX, used as primary input for index database access.

outputs.name: PAUTSUM0
outputs.description: Logical child summary segments in database DBPAUTP0, accessed via the ACCNTID index from the PAUTINDX root segment.

business_rules.description: The root segment PAUTINDX provides index-based access to PAUTSUM0 summary segments using the ACCNTID index total segment index.
business_rules.logic_summary: Defined through LCHILD specification linking PAUTINDX to PAUTSUM0 in DBPAUTP0 with INDEX=ACCNTID.

open_questions.question: What is the exact business meaning of INDXSEQ and ACCNTID fields?
open_questions.context: Field names suggest account indexing (e.g., account ID), but specific data semantics not defined in DBD.
open_questions.suggestion: Review associated PSB, PCB, or application COBOL programs using this database.

open_questions.question: Are there additional segments or fields not shown in this simplified DBD?
open_questions.context: Only one segment defined; production DBDs often have more.
open_questions.suggestion: Examine generated DBD library entry or full IMS database documentation.
